page.title: 01GENERAL OVERVIEW OF AREA.
page.content: The area covered lies in the north-west of the city of{Kingston } {Upon Hull.}This city is not mentioned in the original{Domesday Survey}but trhere was probably a small trading setlement on the north bank of the {Humber}called{Wyke.}This was developed by the monks of{Meaux Abbey}to export wool. In{1293 Edward 1st}bought the land from the monks and in{1299} granted it a{Charter}and its present name. This area consists of{Victorian and} {20th century development}and is mainly {residential,}but about 15% of it remains as{farmland}and there is a good deal of land given over to{light} {industrial usage.}In the north-east of the block lies the region's premier academic institution -{Hull University and part of the{College of Higher} {Education.}
